thread.title: After-school activities make a difference in Burlington
thread.title_full: After-school activities make a difference in Burlington - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: Keith McGilvery
title: After-school activities make a difference in Burlington
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. - Staying after school is proving to be cool for thousands of Burlington students.
The district says about 2,000 of its students are involved in different after-school activities every year and Thursday the community was invited in for the action.
Schools across the city joined more than 7,500 locations across the country for an open house of sorts to give the community a glimpse of the social and academic opportunities for kids once the school bell rings. Christy Gallese, Burlington's director of expanded learning talked about how the afternoon efforts make a difference.
"That after-school is the key solution to closing the achievement gap, it also helps students, students who are known to participate in afterschool, they have higher graduation rates, they stay engaged, their attendance is higher," said Gallese.
"Here we have fun activities and all sorts of stuff for kids of all ages and all sorts of different people, like nerds like me to people who like sports," said Kaif Rahman, fifth-grader at Edmonds Elementary School.
In addition to programming for kids in grades K to 12, the district is also offering after school enrichment opportunities for adults on topics like personal finance and nutrition.
